title: New update to the New Client, have a look
body:
So once again, there has been a few changes to the new client, and here is a showing of what has mostly been added to the new client currently.

http://image.prntscr.com/image/51887d812663421d8928d51b0afd3aa3.png

http://image.prntscr.com/image/28dbd0508aba4a55bf1332e3f874ab16.png

replies.body: Hey can you see other people's champions if your look at their profile, I wish RIOT would add at it in, theres no reason why we shouldnt be able to see champions.

What do you think of the new client so far? My favourite part atm is how the profiles background changes based on your most played champions or the animated ultimate splash of the icon you have equip!

Just the overall look and feel of the new client, it honestly looks amazing, and though there are a few things i hope get changed, it's already great for what will be our new client.

Also question for your Maraudaur, how close are you to the alpha team, because i was hoping i can get it through to them to actually send out some sort of info to everyone in the alpha when an update goes through, because i wasn't aware of the above update until yesterday when someone asked me about the alpha client and what's going on with it.

All things said, this will be my primary client from now on (all i wanted was runes and masteries on the alpha to switch.)

They talk about the updates. Remember to follow a site like Surrender@20. Then you will know what they work on and there are links to posts about changes.

Edit: They work on the client every PBE cycle, and when a new patch comes to live, you can expect something new coming to the client after that. Moobeat posts pictures of the new stuff like you posted above and he also posts links like this one here...
http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/client-update/changelog/7e8e741e-e83f-442e-a928-cdba47d43562#patch-profile which is kinda like a patch notes for the Alpha Client.
there are websites like surrenderat20 for this. k

Interesting because i haven't seen anything about the alpha client on surrenderat20.

Or at least not about these parts that i am showing.

And even then, a lot of people aren't permanently on surrender at 20.
